snippet: Donors have pledged billions to help rebuild Mali after battles with militants, but the collapse of many institutions there has raised doubts about the effort.
abstract: Western donors are pledging both money and oversight to help rebuild Mali after much of country collapsed and fell to Islamist militants in 2012; question remains whether efforts will be enough to remake nation after its civilian and military institutions have fallen, leaving vacuum for militants to exploit.
lead_paragraph: Donors have pledged billions to help rebuild Mali after battles with militants, but the collapse of many institutions there has raised doubts about the effort.

headline.seo: Rebuilding of Mali Is Daunting Task, Despite Aid
headline.main: Rebuilding of Mali Faces Daunting Obstacles, Despite Outside Aid
headline.print_headline: Rebuilding of Mali Faces Daunting Obstacles, Despite Outside Aid
